subject: Programming
title: Measuring Efficiency with Big O
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Measuring Efficiency with Big O.

hook.text: Two algorithms can solve the same problem but take wildly different amounts of time.

buildup.text: Big O notation measures how an algorithm's time grows as the input size increases.

discovery.text: O(n) means time grows linearly. O(nÂ²) means doubling the input quadruples the work.

twist.text: A slow algorithm on 100 items might take hours on 10,000. Big O reveals that before you run it.

climax.text: Big O doesn't measure exact speed. It predicts how algorithms behave at massive scale.

punchline.text: Big O tells you what breaks at scale.
